reviews.review_msg: I was taught in her first term at SFU. We had multiple short assignments that term, no major papers. My TA graded harder than she did, so I was fortunate that she graded the rest of my work. She is very approachable and knowledgeable, and I would take a course with her again. I really enjoyed her class and think she is a great teacher.

The workload for this class is frankly insane... We were assigned 100+ readings nearly every week(many of which didn't contribute much to the topic), as well as 8 writing assignments. On top of that, lectures were very disorganized and practically never finished. Janice was nice enough but it felt like she didn't really care about helping us learn

RUN! Janice singlehandedly ruined my love for history. Her lectures taught nothing, she assigned hundreds of pages of readings per week and 8 papers! She also regularly encouraged us to not try our best. She is not there to support or teach.

Like the other reviews said, Janice seems pretty new to teaching but she puts a lot of effort into her lectures. Berk was my TA and I felt like he really pushed everyone to participate. On days when I didn't do the readings, yes tutorials were hard but when I did, discussions were fun and he was always encouraging when I participated.

Janice is a lovely lady who is clearly pretty new to teaching, which is evident in her lectures. I have two complaints; she is probably the hardest marker I've encountered at SFU which is unfortunate for a 200 level class. She also assigns way too much reading each week, coupled with 8 papers. Janice is cool tho. My TA Berk made me want to unalive.

Like most of the reviews have said, expect a lot of reading with tough grading. It's kind of unfortunate that she marks so harshly because I would totally take a class with her again otherwise. Maybe if her marking was better I'd reconsider. Janice is a really caring, sweet prof. I also have a bone to pick with Berk - how is this guy even a TA???

Where to even begin? If you have Berk as your TA you might as well just drop the course entirely. If you feel like reading 100+ pages a week this is the class for you. 8 papers in a 200 level course? Why not! I think the class average is like 60% in a 200 level history course lmao. Janice is actually really nice but my god the class genuinely sucks

I am fuelled by a burning hatred for Janice and Berk Metin. Literally the worst prof I've had and her lectures are mandatory, yet useless. I only show up for the participation. The TA Berk never responds to emails and will tell you to email him for office hours. Their feedback was harsh and blatantly wrong. Will also accuse you of plagiarism lol gg

Janice is super sweet and you can tell she cares a lot about her students as she tries to make lectures fun and interactive. Around 60 - 90 pages of reading each week along with reading reflections and writing assignments that can often make the class feel non-stop, so not a great class if you're not a history major.

I am never taking her classes again. She is such a hard marker. For assignments, simply meeting her requirements is not enough to have a good score. You have to exceed the requirements just to get a decent mark. Also HEAVY on the heavy reading, there is literally SO MUCH to read for each week. if you take this course make sure your course is light.

I made an account just to talk about this class. Janice is nice, however, the class was a bit frustrating. Initially, there was no feedback besides a slightly vague rubric, but she has since changed this. There are lots of readings and papers, so as a slow reader, it was a bit difficult for me, but if you are fast it's probably fine.

I found Professor Jeong to be very personable and her feedback is always thoughtful. Focused on personal accounts of the history moreso than broad narratives. Lecture attendance is done through weekly inclass writing assignments that are typically a few sentence reflections. Plenty of reading per week but definitely manageable!

Janice is very nice, however her class is run horribly and might be the worst university classes I've ever taken. Lectures are absolutely 0 help and extremely disorganized, but attendance is mandatory and worth a large portion of your mark. 8 papers in a 200 level course. An insane amount of reading per week, often over 100 pages.

Don't take this class. We were the professor's "guinea pigs" as it was her first time teaching. That obviously means that this level 200 course should have 8 papers and 100+ pages of reading per week right? I've never had more passion for a professor than Janice, and it's a passion of hate
